column8: Short description
Personell data exposed on 114,000 current and 123,000 former federal employees.
Employee exfiltrates records on 256,000 consumers to personal computer network.

Hundreds of photographs and typed summaries of confidential documents, maps, casualty estimates, munitions forecasts, war plans of American allies and adversaries, allies’ intercepted communications, and more were leaked.

Hundreds of photographs and typed summaries of confidential documents, maps, casualty estimates, munitions forecasts, war plans of American allies and adversaries, allies’ intercepted communications, and more were leaked.

Hundreds of photographs and typed summaries of confidential documents, maps, casualty estimates, munitions forecasts, war plans of American allies and adversaries, allies’ intercepted communications, and more were leaked.

Hundreds of photographs and typed summaries of confidential documents, maps, casualty estimates, munitions forecasts, war plans of American allies and adversaries, allies’ intercepted communications, and more were leaked.

US Marshals Service loses control of "law enforcement sensitive information, including returns from legal process, administrative information, and personally identifiable information pertaining to subjects of USMS investigations, third parties, and certain USMS employees.”
An computer system used for investigations of images of child sexual exploitation was hacked.
An email server was reportedly misconfigured, leaving over 3TB of email traffic, including sensitive personnell forms, available on a public server.
Old Terrorist Screening Database, aka No Fly list was taken from unsecured server.

column5: House Select Committee on the January 6 Attack
column8: Social security numbers of nearly 2,000 people who visited the White House in December 2020 were posted publicly.

column5: House Committee on Ways and Means
column8: Over 2,700 pages of President Donald and First Lady Melania's Trump's tax returns are disclosed by law to the Democratically led House Ways and Means Committee, which then disclosed them to the public.
Administrative data was lost on 6,252 immigrants seeking asylum and other protections from claims of torture and persecution, including names, birth dates, nationalities and detention locations.

About 500,000 VA staff members' vaccination statuses, including religious and medical exemptions, were shared via spreadsheet widely among internal middle and higher level manages who did not have any compelling reason, medical, managerial, or oversight, to receive the information.

CISA and FBI say Iranian state-sponsored APT actors exploited vulnerabilities to steal credentials and mine cryptocurrencies from inside the networks of a federal executive branch civilian agency. Other organizations that discover infections should "assume lateral movement by threat actors."
Hackers gained long-term access to networks of defense contractors.
IRS posts tax Form 990-T from over 120,000 taxpayers publicly to the web, apparently by mistake.
Draft opinion on opinion overturning Roe v. Wade leaked to press.
IPhones of at least 9 State Department employees in Uganda were hacked using software from Israeli-based NSO Group.
Staff emails were monitored by hackers for months
FBI's Law Enforcement Enterprise Portal is hacked and fake emails sent from an FBI email acount (@ic.fbi.gov) about an imminent, fictitious, cyber attack.
Staff emails were monitored by hackers for months

1.9 million record terrorist watchlist available on public site for at least three weeks with detailed passport data and no-fly indicator.

Adversary believed to have access to compromised accounts from approximately May 7 to December 27, 2020...The compromised data included all sent, received, and stored emails and attachments...While other districts were impacted to a lesser degree, the adversary gained access to least 80 percent of employees working in the U.S. Attorneys’ offices in New York. - DOJ Statement

Staff emails were monitored by hackers for months.

CBP leaked Biometric data including over 184,000 traveler images from CBP's facial recognition pilot, as well as 105,000 license plate images, contractual documents, program management documents, emails, system configurations, schematics, and implementation documents.
